titlestmt.subtitle: An inventory of the collection at Syracuse University
titlestmt.author: MB

list.item: 8 May 2019 - added Articles, Book Outlines and Reviews, Speeches (KD)

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: Papers of the American industrial designer; died 1960. Collection includes graphic designs, business files, correspondence, construction files, manuscripts, memorabilia, models, and published writings.

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: Walter Dorwin Teague (1883-1960) was an American industrial designer and founder of Walter Dorwin Teague Associates. For more than eighty years, the company -- known today simply as "Teague" -- has designed everything from aircrafts to gas stations to cameras, in some cases maintaining a decades-long relationships with satisfied clients (their work for Boeing spanned sixty years and four aircraft models). Today, the company lists Hewlett Packard, Nike, Microsoft and other major corporations among their clients.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p: The Walter Dorwin Teague Papers is divided into eight series.
Source material contains original and reproduced works of others — art, printing, and lettering.
Designs comprises posters, pamphlets, illustrations, advertisements, border designs, product and package designs, and architectural designs.

Files is subdivided into four sections: Ritter Company, Boeing, U.S. Air Force, and General. Because the collection has received minimal processing, the General section also contains material related to the three named companies; the researcher is advised to read the inventory carefully to ensure location of all relevant items. The Boeing material includes shop drawings at the end.

The bulk of
Memorabilia consists of samples — fabric, hardware, paneling. Other items include metal models and equipment order catalogues.
Writings is subdivided into published material, much of which has been removed for separate cataloging, and typescripts. Most relates to Teague's books. It includes articles and speeches by Teague.

By far the largest segment of the collection, the U
.S. Air Force Academy series, concerning the Colorado Springs complex built in the late 1950s, contains specifications, construction drawings, files, correspondence, and equipment design catalogues.
Miscellaneous material (a scrapbook of news clippings, a model cash register, a crude model of the DNA molecule) completes the collection.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection has received minimal processing. It is in rough order by series and within each series is roughly alphabetical.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: Some published items have been removed from the collection and transferred to Rare Books for cataloging. Please see the Writings section of the inventory below for more information.

otherfindaid.head: Other Related Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: A finding aid for the microfilm collection is also available (hard copy only). Please contact the repository listed above for more information.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The majority of our archival and manuscript collections are housed offsite and require advanced notice for retrieval. Researchers are encouraged to contact us in advance concerning the collection material they wish to access for their research.
Care should be taken when handling the material, as much of the paper is fragile/brittle.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Written permission must be obtained from SCRC and all relevant rights holders before publishing quotations, excerpts or images from any materials in this collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Majority, gift of Mrs. Walter Dorwin Teague (Ruth), 1965.
